sentence.text: Is it right that liability for the second most heinous crime in English law , which carries a maximum penalty of life imprisonment , should be satisfied by this relatively low grade of fault ?
The argument of all crackdown law is that it applies special , draconian measures to tackle some heinous crime .
At the time the Tunisian Government stated that this execution was an exception , carried out because of the particularly heinous nature of the crime .
The law must resort to some kind of moral and social evaluation of conduct if it is to identify and separate out the most heinous killings .
The reason for distinguishing between murder and manslaughter must be to identify and to label the most heinous killings as murder , and it has been questioned whether English law succeeds in this .

Provoked killings are generally thought to be less heinous than unprovoked killings , and provocation has long been accepted as a ground for reducing to manslaughter a killing which would otherwise fulfil the definition of murder .
There is certainly some indication that the public perceives homosexual rape , particularly if perpetrated against a child , as an especially heinous offence .
If the circumstances of this crime -- that is the eating of the apple -- are duly considered , it will be acknowledged to have been a most heinous offence and a transgression of the whole law .
You 've got a very religious person here , preparing to commit a heinous sin beneath God 's gaze , and here 's a religious symbol strengthening His power about the victim 's neck .

One of the most heinous of Menzies ' sins was the fact that he was not a Navy man in the tradition of the one-legged Smith-Cumming -- who had coined the title ` C " for holders of the post -- or Admiral Sinclair .
What purpose is served by such senseless and heinous acts ?
In other words , does English criminal law pick out the most heinous forms of killing as murders and manslaughters , or are the boundaries frozen by tradition ?
It is clear from the differential sentencing that the judge considered that the rape of the men was a particularly heinous aspect of the case .
Evil in Germany was so heinous , so unmistakable in the late 1930s , that all the world would assuredly join forces to wipe it out .
Her crime was aggravated by a breach of the employer 's trust and was therefore judged the more heinous .
The way he had misled her , Blanche thought , was heinous enough if his loyalty had lain with the same country .
